moves.1. Nf3: Reti opening. Supposedly the 4th common opening on GK. I can't stand king's pawn openings, and I can't play queen's pawn openings with the d4 move... so I prefer this opening.
moves.1... e6 2. d4 Ne7 3. c4 d6: I don't know if this was conservative playing or some sort of fool's check mate that I was missing.
moves.4. Nc3 b6 5. e4: Since parizadeh isn't pushing past two spaces I decided to make an all out offensive play into the middle.
moves.6... exd5 7. cxd5 Bg7 8. Nd4: I choose to sack the knight to keep up with the complete control of the center...
moves.10. Bxa6: could have cut losses here by castling still...
moves.10... Nxa6 11. Qxh8+ Kd7 12. Qd4: opt not to take the queen in hopes of a faster checkmate (vs end game play).
moves.12... Nc5 13. Na4: Another sack to clear out black material
moves.14... c6 15. dxc6+ Nxc6 16. O-O f5 17. e: bad pawn move on nickwan's part.
moves.17... dxe5: although it plays out with a bad take on parizadeh's part...
